reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: To reduce TB & MDR-TB burden in Bhutan

description.narrative: Bhutan - Tuberculosis - Ministry of Health of the Royal Government of Bhutan - MOH. This program has the following goals: To reduce TB and MDR TB burden untill it no longer poses a public health problem in Bhutan. The objectives of this program are: Objective: To ensure early diagnosis and treatment of all MDR-TB cases and sustain Treatment Success Rate of 85%. Objective: To sustain and increase case notification rate of ≥ 90% among prevalent cases. Objective: To sustain and increase treatment success rate of ≥ 90%. Objective: Improve TB-HIV collaborative activities and increase HIV testing among TB patients to 80%

title.narrative: Coverage / Output indicator for BTN-T-MOH
Percentage of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB started on treatment for MDR-TB who were lost to follow up during the first six months of treatment
Percentage of DST laboratories showing adequate performance on External Quality Assurance
Percentage of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients on ART during TB treatment
Percentage of people living with HIV initiated on ART who are screened for TB in HIV treatment settings
Number of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified

Percentage of laboratories showing adequate performance in external quality assurance for smear microscopy among the total number of laboratories that undertake smear microscopy during the reporting period
Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines
Percentage of reporting units reporting no stock-outs of anti-TB drugs on the last day of the quarter
Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment

TCP-other 2: Percentage of bacteriologically confirmed TB cases successfully treated (cured plus completed treatment) among the bacteriologically confirmed TB cases registered during a specified period
TCP-other 1: Number of notified cases of bacteriologically confirmed TB, new and relapses
Percentage of registered new and relapse TB patients with documented HIV status
Number of notified cases of all forms of TB (i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed), new and relapse cases
MDR TB-Other 1: Percentage of previously treated TB patients receiving DST (bacteriologically positive cases only)

Treatment success rate- all forms: Percentage of TB cases, all forms, bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, successfully treated (cured plus treatment completed) among all TB cases registered for treatment during a specified period, new and relapse cases
PSM-other 1: Percentage of health facilities reporting no stock-outs of essential drugs
Impact indicator for BTN-T-MOH
RR-TB and/or MDR-TB prevalence among new TB patients: Proportion of new TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB
TB mortality rate per 100,000 population
TB incidence rate per 100,000 population
TB prevalence rate per 100,000 population
Outcome indicator for BTN-T-MOH

Notification of RR-TB and/or MDR-TB cases - Percentage of notified cases of bacteriologically confirmed, drug resistant RR-TB and/or MDR-TB⃰ as a proportion of the estimated number of RR-TB and/or MDR-TB cases among notified TB cases
Case notification rate of all forms of TB per 100,000 population - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases
TB O-other 1: Case notification rate per 100,000 population- bacteriologically-confirmed TB, new and relapse
Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated
TB O-other 2: Treatment success rate - bacteriologically confirmed TB cases
Treatment success rate of all forms of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases

TB treatment coverage: Percentage of new and relapse cases that were notified and treated among the estimated number of incident TB cases in the same year (all form of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed)
